page.title: 02Changes in Employment
page.content: Traditionally, Bakewell's main source of employment has been agriculture. Lead mining was also a reliable source of employment in the area for many years. Many people, especially women, came from surrounding villages to work in Bakewell. If a child was orphaned or its parents were unable to provide for it, compulsory apprenticeship would take place. Girls would be taken into domestic service and boys would often go into trade in Sheffield or local agriculture. In recent years, many new occupations have developed in service industries such as plumbing, electrical contractors, builders, garages and agricultural services. Today's population is very much a commuter population, travelling to work in nearby centres of commerce, such as Sheffield, Matlock or Derby.
